N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.475 - Internal corrosion control: general

State Regulations
(a) Corrosive gas may not be transported by
pipeline, unless the corrosive effect of the gas on the pipeline has been
investigated and steps have been taken to minimize internal
corrosion. (b) Whenever any pipe is
removed from a pipeline for any reason, the internal surface must be inspected
for evidence of corrosion. If internal corrosion is found, the following
requirements apply: (1)

The adjacent pipe must
be investigated to determine the extent of internal corrosion. (2)

Replacement must be made to the extent
required by the applicable requirements of section
255.485, 255.487 or
255.489
of this Part. (3)

Steps must be taken to minimize the
internal corrosion. Notes
